thread.title: Lacklustre Western Australian tourism blamed on east coast favouritism
thread.title_full: Lacklustre Western Australian tourism blamed on east coast favouritism | Travel | The Guardian

title: Lacklustre Western Australian tourism blamed on east coast favouritism
text:
The Australian Hotels Association has blamed Western Australiaâ€™s poor tourist spending levels on east coast favouritism and unsatisfactory state government funding.
Related: Scientists push for Unesco listing for huge area of Western Australia 
WA is missing out on significant growth in tourist expenditure in Australia , with international visitor survey data showing a 1.2% increase compared with the national average of 11.5%, the AHA chief executive, Bradley Woods, said.
WA tourism was being held back by inadequate state government funding and too much focus by Tourism Australia on attracting visitors to the east coast.
Woods said the WA government needed to increase its destination advertising budget by tens of millions of dollars.
Visitor numbers to WA rose by 4% last financial year compared with an 8% rise in Queensland , 6% in NSW and 22% in Tasmania.
